comments:
Using initial contribution, if I open and close a very large faces config file with many nav cases several times, the workspace will crash with:

Unhandled event loop exception
Reason:
No more handles
Error while informing user about event loop exception:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2968)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2865)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2836)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.init(Image.java:1777)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.init(Image.java:1875)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.<init>(Image.java:596)
	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:295)
	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:233)
	at org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor.createImage(ImageDescriptor.java:211)
	at org.eclipse.wtp.jsf.facesconfig.editor.pageflow.editparts.PageflowNodeEditPart$ImageDecorator.decorateImage(PageflowNodeEditPart.java:86)
	at org.eclipse.wtp.jsf.facesconfig.editor.pageflow.editparts.PageflowNodeEditPart.getDecoratedImage(PageflowNodeEditPart.java:447)
...

This can be reproduced by importing the Oracle ADF demo WAR found at: http://www.oracle.com/technology/products/jdev/htdocs/partners/addins/exchange/jsf/index.html

Once the WAR has been imported open and close the faces-config.xml 3 or 4 times.  

I am using Win2K with -vmargs -Xmx512M
fixed and checkin to the CVS.

Although it took longer, problem remains...

In case you are not already aware, there is a very handy tool to help look for SWT resource leaks called S-LEAK.

http://www.eclipse.org/articles/swt-design-2/sleak.htm
It is a resource-leak bug, usually caused by font / image / color not being disposed.

I checked all the codes and found we did not handle the font and color correctly. Basically we need to dispose the font after we use it. So I use FontRegistry and ColorRegistry to handle it. It should work fine now.
Can no longer reproduce with R-1.5.1
